radiographic_examinations.findings: Communication between the right portal vein and the right hepatic vein
Evidence of persistent interstitial edema and focal opacities in both lower lobes; could represent alveolar edema, superimposed pneumonia, or aspiration
Nonspecific pneumatosis of the ascending colon to the level of the hepatic flexure; cholelithiasis, atherosclerotic disease of the aorta and mesenteric vessels, and cardiomegaly
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Angiography showed that the dominant fistula was surrounded by numerous smaller fistulae that had not been noted on previous imaging studies
